arXiv:2502.01633v2 [cs.LG] 25 Jun 2025

Adversarial Reasoning at Jailbreaking Time
在越狱时间进行对抗性推理

Mahdi Sabbaghi Paul Kassianik George Pappas Yaron Singer Amin Karbasi Hamed Hassani
Abstract  摘要

As large language models (LLMs) are becoming more capable and widespread, the study of their failure cases is becoming increasingly important. Recent advances in standardizing, measuring, and scaling test-time compute suggest new methodologies for optimizing models to achieve high performance on hard tasks. In this paper, we apply these advances to the task of “model jailbreaking”: eliciting harmful responses from aligned LLMs. We develop an adversarial reasoning approach to automatic jailbreaking that leverages a loss signal to guide the test-time compute, achieving SOTA attack success rates against many aligned LLMs, even those that aim to trade inference-time compute for adversarial robustness. Our approach introduces a new paradigm in understanding LLM vulnerabilities, laying the foundation for the development of more robust and trustworthy AI systems. Code is available at Github.
随着大型语言模型（LLMs）的能力不断增强和普及，对其失效情况的研究变得越来越重要。近期在标准化、测量和扩展测试时计算方面的进展，为优化模型以在困难任务上实现高性能提供了新的方法论。在本文中，我们将这些进展应用于“模型越狱”任务：从对齐的 LLMs 中诱发出有害响应。我们开发了一种基于对抗性推理的自动越狱方法，该方法利用损失信号来指导测试时计算，在许多对齐的 LLMs 上实现了 SOTA 攻击成功率，即使那些试图用推理时计算来换取对抗鲁棒性的模型也不例外。我们的方法为理解 LLM 漏洞引入了一种新范式，为开发更鲁棒和值得信赖的 AI 系统奠定了基础。代码可在 Github 上获取。

Machine Learning, ICML   机器学习，ICML

1 Introduction  1 引言

Large language models (LLMs) are increasingly deployed with various safety techniques to ensure alignment with human values. Common strategies include RLHF (Christiano et al., 2017; Ouyang et al., 2022), DPO (Rafailov et al., 2024), and the usage of dedicated guardrail models (Inan et al., 2023; Rebedea et al., 2023). In nominal use cases, alignment methods typically refuse to generate objectionable content, but adversarially designed prompts can bypass these guardrails. A challenge known as jailbreaking consists of finding prompts that circumvent safety measures and elicit undesirable behaviors.
大型语言模型（LLMs）越来越多地部署了各种安全技术以确保与人类价值观保持一致。常见的策略包括 RLHF（Christiano 等人，2017 年；Ouyang 等人，2022 年）、DPO（Rafailov 等人，2024 年）以及使用专门的护栏模型（Inan 等人，2023 年；Rebedea 等人，2023 年）。在常规使用场景中，对齐方法通常会拒绝生成有争议的内容，但对抗性设计的提示可以绕过这些护栏。一个被称为越狱的挑战包括寻找能够绕过安全措施并引发不良行为的提示。

Current jailbreaking methods fall into two categories: token-space and semantic-space attacks. Token-space attacks (Shin et al., 2020; Wen et al., 2023; Zou et al., 2023; Hayase et al., 2024; Andriushchenko et al., 2024a) focus on token-level modifications of the input to minimize some loss value, often using gradient-based heuristics (Zou et al., 2023) or random searches (Andriushchenko et al., 2024a). Such methods view jailbreaking as an optimization problem over sequences of tokens and use the loss information to inform their navigation through the optimization landscape. As a consequence, token-level methods produce semantically meaningless input prompts that can be mitigated by perplexity-based or smoothing-based filters (Alon & Kamfonas, 2023; Robey et al., 2024b).
当前的越狱方法分为两类：token 空间攻击和语义空间攻击。Token 空间攻击（Shin 等人，2020；Wen 等人，2023；Zou 等人，2023；Hayase 等人，2024；Andriushchenko 等人，2024a）专注于对输入进行 token 级别的修改以最小化某些损失值，通常使用基于梯度的启发式方法（Zou 等人，2023）或随机搜索（Andriushchenko 等人，2024a）。这类方法将越狱视为对 token 序列的优化问题，并使用损失信息来指导其在优化空间中的导航。因此，token 级别的攻击会产生语义上无意义的输入提示，这些问题可以通过基于困惑度或平滑的过滤器来缓解（Alon & Kamfonas，2023；Robey 等人，2024b）。

In contrast, semantic-space attacks generate semantically coherent adversarial prompts using techniques like multi-round LLM interactions or fine-tuning for crafted outputs (Chao et al., 2024b; Ge et al., 2023; Liu et al., 2024b; Mehrotra et al., 2024; Zeng et al., 2024; Samvelyan et al., 2024; Liu et al., 2024a). A notable subset deploys chain-of-thought reasoning (Wei et al., 2023b; Nye et al., 2021) to guide the interaction with the target LLM and better navigate the prompt search space (Chao et al., 2024b; Mehrotra et al., 2024). These methods are designed to exploit binary feedback from the target LLM of the form “has the current prompt jailbroken the target LLM or not?”. Binary feedback effectively quantifies attack success on black-box models, but it provides limited information for the intermediate stages. This sparsity hampers search effectiveness in the prompt space to exploit the safety vulnerabilities of the target LLM, particularly against adversarially trained models (Zou et al., 2024; Sheshadri et al., 2024; Xhonneux et al., 2024). An extensive search through the prompt space requires a more granular signal—e.g., loss values—to efficiently traverse the prompt landscape and identify the target LLM weaknesses.
相比之下，语义空间攻击使用多轮 LLM 交互或针对定制输出的微调等技术，生成语义上连贯的对抗性提示（Chao 等人，2024b；Ge 等人，2023；Liu 等人，2024b；Mehrotra 等人，2024；Zeng 等人，2024；Samvelyan 等人，2024；Liu 等人，2024a）。一个值得注意的子集采用思维链推理（Wei 等人，2023b；Nye 等人，2021）来指导与目标 LLM 的交互，并更好地导航提示搜索空间（Chao 等人，2024b；Mehrotra 等人，2024）。这些方法旨在利用目标 LLM 提供的二元反馈，即“当前提示是否越狱了目标 LLM？”二元反馈有效地量化了黑盒模型上的攻击成功，但它为中间阶段提供了有限的信息。 这种稀疏性阻碍了在提示空间中搜索以利用目标 LLM 的安全漏洞，特别是针对对抗训练的模型（Zou 等人，2024；Sheshadri 等人，2024；Xhonneux 等人，2024）。要在提示空间中进行广泛搜索，需要更精细的信号——例如，损失值——以高效地遍历提示空间并识别目标 LLM 的弱点。

In this paper, we present Adversarial Reasoning: a framework that uses reasoning to effectively exploit the feedback signals provided by the target LLM to bypass its guardrails. Adversarial Reasoning consists of three key steps: reason, verify, and search. We utilize a loss function derived from the target’s response to guide the process. The reasoning step constructs chain-of-thought (CoT) paths aiming to reduce the loss values. The verifier assigns a score based on loss values to each intermediate step of the reasoning paths. Finally, the search step, informed by the verifier, prunes the CoT paths and sometimes backtracks to obtain a minimal-loss solution. To realize the adversarial reasoning steps, we employ three LLM-based modules: (1) Attacker, which generates the attacking prompts based on the reasoning instructions; (2) Feedback LLM, which determines how to further reduce the loss; and (3) Refiner LLM, which incorporates the feedback into the next round of prompt generation. Figures 1 and 2 illustrate our method. Our approach centers on two key reasoning elements. First, employing the loss function as a step-wise verifier analogous to process-based reward models (PRMs), and second, scaling test-time computation under the guidance of this verifier. We elaborate on these points in Section 2.
在本文中，我们提出了对抗性推理：一个利用推理来有效利用目标 LLM 提供的反馈信号以绕过其防护措施的框架。对抗性推理包括三个关键步骤：推理、验证和搜索。我们利用从目标响应中推导出的损失函数来指导整个过程。推理步骤构建思维链（CoT）路径，旨在降低损失值。验证器根据损失值对推理路径的每个中间步骤进行评分。最后，搜索步骤在验证器的指导下修剪思维链路径，有时会回溯以获得最小损失解。为了实现对抗性推理步骤，我们采用了三个基于 LLM 的模块：（1）攻击者，根据推理指令生成攻击提示；（2）反馈 LLM，确定如何进一步降低损失；（3）精炼 LLM，将反馈纳入下一轮提示生成。图 1 和图 2 说明了我们的方法。我们的方法基于两个关键推理元素。 首先，将损失函数作为类似于基于过程的奖励模型（PRMs）的逐步验证器，其次，在验证器的指导下扩展测试时的计算。我们在第 2 节详细阐述这些要点。

Our contributions are summarized as follows:
我们的贡献总结如下：

  • •

    In this paper, we formulate jailbreaking as a reasoning problem. We then apply insights from the reasoning field and lessons from existing token-space and semantic methods to create a strong, adaptive, gradient-free, and transferable jailbreaking algorithm.


    • 在本文中，我们将越狱行为视为一个推理问题。然后，我们应用推理领域的见解以及现有标记空间和语义方法的经验教训，创建一个强大、自适应、无梯度且可迁移的越狱算法。
  • •

    Experimentally, we show that our method achieves state-of-the-art success rates among semantic-space attacks and outperforms token-space methods for many target LLMs, particularly those that have been adversarially trained (see Table 1). Notably, our method enhances the jailbreaking performance significantly when a weak LLM is used as the attacker (Table 3), reflecting the benefits of optimizing test-time computation. We further introduce a multi-shot transfer scenario—as the method relies on the target’s logit vectors—that outperforms existing methods and achieves 56% success rate on OpenAI o1-preview (Table 4) and 100% on Deepseek. Finally, in our ablation studies, we show that (i) our method effectively reduces the loss (Figure 3) and quantitatively demonstrate the key role of the feedback (Figure 4); (ii) a frontier reasoning model such as Deepseek-R1 (DeepSeek-AI, 2025) as the attacker does not gain additional success when working heuristically and not supervised; and (iii) our method benefits from deeper reasoning, i.e., it continues to discover new jailbreaks with more iterations. (Figure 5).


    • 实验结果表明，我们的方法在语义空间攻击中达到了最先进的成功率，并且在许多目标 LLMs 上优于 token 空间方法，特别是那些经过对抗训练的 LLMs（见表 1）。值得注意的是，当使用弱 LLM 作为攻击者时，我们的方法显著提升了越狱性能（见表 3），这反映了优化测试时计算的好处。我们进一步引入了一种多样本迁移场景——由于该方法依赖于目标的 logit 向量——其性能优于现有方法，在 OpenAI o1-preview 上达到了 56%的成功率（见表 4），在 Deepseek 上达到了 100%。最后，在我们的消融研究中，我们展示了：(i)我们的方法有效降低了损失（见图 3），并定量地证明了反馈的关键作用（见图 4）；(ii)作为攻击者的前沿推理模型（如 Deepseek-R1（DeepSeek-AI，2025））在启发式工作和非监督工作时并未获得额外的成功；(iii)我们的方法受益于更深层次的推理，即它能够随着更多迭代继续发现新的越狱方法（见图 5）。

2 Related Work  2 相关工作

Comparison with PAIR and TAP. The closest methods to our framework are PAIR (Chao et al., 2024b) and TAP-T (Mehrotra et al., 2024). Our verifier-driven method outperforms PAIR and TAP that rely on LLM’s inherent CoT reasoning and does not leverage a loss. That said, while TAP-T creates a tree of attacks based on the attacker’s CoT, it prunes only prompts that do not request the same content as the original intent, and does not utilize any reasoning methodologies.
与 PAIR 和 TAP 的比较。与我们框架最接近的方法是 PAIR（Chao 等人，2024b）和 TAP-T（Mehrotra 等人，2024）。我们的基于验证器的方法优于依赖 LLM 固有 Chain-of-Thought（CoT）推理且不利用损失的 PAIR 和 TAP。换句话说，虽然 TAP-T 基于攻击者的 CoT 创建攻击树，但它仅剪枝不请求与原始意图相同内容的提示，并且不利用任何推理方法。

Chain-of-Thought (CoT). CoT prompting (Wei et al., 2023b) and scratch-padding (Nye et al., 2021) demonstrate how prompting the model to produce a step-by-step solution improves the LLM’s performance. Recent work (Zheng et al., 2024; Wang et al., 2024b; Xiang et al., 2025) suggests constructing the CoT through several modules rather than relying only on the language model’s CoT capabilities. Notably, (Xiang et al., 2025) explicitly constructs the CoT to ensure that it follows a particular path. Likewise, we use three modules for explicitly constructing the reasoning steps, aiming to reduce the loss function with each step.
思维链（CoT）。思维链提示（Wei 等人，2023b）和从零填充（Nye 等人，2021）展示了如何通过提示模型生成逐步解决方案来提高 LLM 的性能。近期工作（Zheng 等人，2024；Wang 等人，2024b；Xiang 等人，2025）建议通过多个模块构建 CoT，而不是仅依赖语言模型的 CoT 能力。值得注意的是，（Xiang 等人，2025）明确构建 CoT 以确保其遵循特定路径。类似地，我们使用三个模块来明确构建推理步骤，旨在每一步减少损失函数。

Reasoning. Recent advances in reasoning have enhanced LLMs’ capabilities in solving complex problems by scaling test-time computation mechanisms (Hendrycks et al., 2021; Romera-Paredes et al., 2023; Ahn et al., 2024; Shao et al., 2024; Rein et al., 2023; OpenAI, 2024b). “Best-of-N” sampling (Cobbe et al., 2021; Yu et al., 2024), which runs N parallel streams and verifies the final answers through outcome-based reward models (ORMs), is a straightforward test-time scaling approach. However, it might fail to uncover solutions that require incremental improvements, limiting its effectiveness compared to other test-time methods. To address this limitation, recent work utilizes process-based reward models (PRMs) (Uesato et al., 2022; Lightman et al., 2023; Wang et al., 2024a) to optimally scale the test-time computation, thereby improving the reasoning performance (Snell et al., 2024; Xie et al., 2024; Gandhi et al., 2024; OpenAI, 2024a). PRMs provide step-by-step verification that facilitates a look-ahead signal at each step, often necessary for a searching algorithm (Xie et al., 2024). Similarly, the use of a continuous loss function as a step-wise verifier allows us to run a tree search. This framework fits well into the “Proposer and Verifier” perspective (Snell et al., 2024) of test-time computation, where the proposer proposes a distribution of solutions and a verifier assigns rewards to the proposed distributions. Robust verifier models are essential for accurate guidance (Zhang et al., 2024a, b; Stechly et al., 2024), but they require intermediate annotations from human annotators or heuristics (Uesato et al., 2022; Lightman et al., 2023; Wang et al., 2024a). In our work, we use the loss values from a surrogate LLM as a verifier, eliminating the need for training a verifier model.
推理。推理领域的最新进展通过扩展测试时的计算机制增强了 LLMs 解决复杂问题的能力（Hendrycks 等人，2021 年；Romera-Paredes 等人，2023 年；Ahn 等人，2024 年；Shao 等人，2024 年；Rein 等人，2023 年；OpenAI，2024b）。"最佳 N"采样（Cobbe 等人，2021 年；Yu 等人，2024 年），该方法运行 N 个并行流并通过基于结果的奖励模型（ORMs）验证最终答案，是一种直接的测试时扩展方法。然而，它可能无法发现需要逐步改进的解决方案，与其他测试时方法相比，其有效性有限。为了解决这一局限性，近期工作利用基于过程的奖励模型（PRMs）（Uesato 等人，2022 年；Lightman 等人，2023 年；Wang 等人，2024a）来优化测试时的计算扩展，从而提高推理性能（Snell 等人，2024 年；Xie 等人，2024 年；Gandhi 等人，2024 年；OpenAI，2024a）。 PRMs 提供逐步验证，便于每一步提供前瞻信号，这对于搜索算法（Xie 等人，2024）通常必不可少。类似地，将连续损失函数用作逐步验证器，使我们能够运行树搜索。该框架很好地契合了测试时计算的“提议者与验证者”视角（Snell 等人，2024），其中提议者提出解决方案的分布，验证者则为提出的分布分配奖励。 鲁棒的验证器模型对于精确指导至关重要（Zhang 等人，2024a，b；Stechly 等人，2024），但它们需要人类标注者或启发式算法的中间标注（Uesato 等人，2022；Lightman 等人，2023；Wang 等人，2024a）。在我们的工作中，我们使用替代 LLM 的损失值作为验证器，从而无需训练验证器模型。

Reasoning vs safety. The reasoning framework for exploiting test-time compute can also be used to improve alignment. OpenAI uses “deliberative alignment” (Guan et al., 2025) to incorporate human-generated and adversarial data to improve the alignment of the o1 model family (OpenAI, 2024a, b). These models consistently outperform traditional frontier LLMs in metrics measuring vulnerability to automatic adversarial attacks (OpenAI, 2024b; Hughes et al., 2024). The limitations of current automatic jailbreaking methods and the efficacy of using test-time compute for safety alignment naturally beg the question of whether test-time compute frameworks can be used to bypass model guardrails instead of enforcing them. Adversarial reasoning, the framework we propose in this paper, demonstrates that bypassing a model’s guardrails—even those that leverage increased computation for enhanced safety—is not only possible but also effective. Additional related work is provided in Appendix A.
推理与安全。用于利用测试时计算的推理框架也可用于提高对齐性。OpenAI 使用“审慎对齐”（Guan 等人，2025）将人类生成和对抗性数据结合起来，以提高 o1 模型系列的对齐性（OpenAI，2024a，b）。这些模型在衡量对自动对抗性攻击的脆弱性的指标上始终优于传统的边界 LLM（OpenAI，2024b；Hughes 等人，2024）。当前自动越狱方法的局限性以及使用测试时计算进行安全对齐的有效性，自然引出了一个问题：测试时计算框架是否可以用来绕过模型护栏，而不是强制执行它们。对抗性推理，即本文提出的框架，证明绕过模型的护栏——即使是那些利用增加计算来增强安全的护栏——不仅是可能的，而且是有效的。更多相关工作在附录 A 中提供。

3 Preliminaries  3 预备知识

The objective of jailbreaking is to elicit a target LLM 𝕋𝕋\mathbb{T}blackboard_T to generate objectionable content corresponding to a malicious intent I𝐼Iitalic_I (i.e., “Tell me how to build a bomb”). This will be obtained by designing a prompt P𝑃Pitalic_P such that the target LLM’s response 𝕋⁢(P)𝕋𝑃\mathbb{T}(P)blackboard_T ( italic_P ) corresponds to I𝐼Iitalic_I. A judge function, Judge⁢(Target⁢(P),I)→{0,1}→JudgeTarget𝑃𝐼01\mathrm{Judge}(\mathrm{Target}(P),I)\to\{0,1\}roman_Judge ( roman_Target ( italic_P ) , italic_I ) → { 0 , 1 }, is then used to decide whether the response satisfies this condition. Therefore, successful jailbreaking amounts to finding a prompt P𝑃Pitalic_P such that:
越狱的目标是诱使目标 LLM 𝕋\mathbb{T}blackboard_T 生成与恶意意图 IIitalic_I 相应的令人反感的內容（即，“告诉我如何制造炸弹”）。这可以通过设计一个提示 PPitalic_P 来实现，使得目标 LLM 的响应 𝕋⁢(P)\mathbb{T}(P)blackboard_T ( italic_P ) 与 IIitalic_I 相符。然后使用一个裁判函数 Judge⁢(Target⁢(P),I)→{0,1}01\mathrm{Judge}(\mathrm{Target}(P),I)\to\{0,1\}roman_Judge ( roman_Target ( italic_P ) , italic_I ) → { 0 , 1 } 来判断响应是否满足此条件。因此，成功的越狱相当于找到一个提示 PPitalic_P ，使得：

Judge⁢(𝕋⁢(P),I)=1.Judge𝕋𝑃𝐼1\mathrm{Judge}\big{(}\mathbb{T}(P),I\big{)}=1.roman_Judge ( blackboard_T ( italic_P ) , italic_I ) = 1 .

We reinterpret this problem as a reasoning problem. Rather than directly optimizing the prompt P𝑃Pitalic_P as token-level methods do, we construct P𝑃Pitalic_P by applying an attacker LLM 𝔸𝔸\mathbb{A}blackboard_A to a reasoning string S𝑆Sitalic_S, i.e., P=𝔸⁢(S)𝑃𝔸𝑆P=\mathbb{A}(S)italic_P = blackboard_A ( italic_S ). This allows us to update the attacker’s output distribution according to the “Proposer and Verifier” framework (Snell et al., 2024) by iteratively refining S𝑆Sitalic_S. Thus, the challenge is to find a string S𝑆Sitalic_S such that, when passed to the attacker as shown in Figure 1, it satisfies the following objective:
我们将这个问题重新解释为一个推理问题。与 token 级方法直接优化提示 PPitalic_P 不同，我们通过将攻击者 LLM 𝔸\mathbb{A}blackboard_A 应用于推理字符串 SSitalic_S 来构建 PPitalic_P ，即 P=𝔸⁢(S)P=\mathbb{A}(S)italic_P = blackboard_A ( italic_S ) 。这使我们能够根据“提议者与验证者”框架（Snell 等人，2024 年）通过迭代细化 SSitalic_S 来更新攻击者的输出分布。因此，挑战在于找到一个字符串 SSitalic_S ，当如图 1 所示传递给攻击者时，它满足以下目标：

Judge⁢(𝕋⁢(𝔸⁢(S)),I)=1.Judge𝕋𝔸𝑆𝐼1\mathrm{Judge}\big{(}\mathbb{T}(\mathbb{A}(S)),I\big{)}=1.roman_Judge ( blackboard_T ( blackboard_A ( italic_S ) ) , italic_I ) = 1 . (3.1)

This formulation allows us to view jailbreaking methods through the lens of an iterative refinement of S𝑆Sitalic_S. Note that many existing reasoning algorithms can be framed into this formulation. For instance, chain-of-thought prompting can be realized by repeatedly generating partial thoughts from an LLM and appending them to S𝑆Sitalic_S. The final answer is generated by passing the updated S𝑆Sitalic_S to the same LLM. Similarly, in the jailbreaking literature, methods such as PAIR (Chao et al., 2024b) aim to solve (3.1) by updating S𝑆Sitalic_S at each iteration, appending the generated CoT from the attacker and the responses from the target. The string S𝑆Sitalic_S encapsulates all partial instructions and the intermediate steps executed during the attacking process.
这种表述方式使我们能够通过迭代改进 SSitalic_S 的视角来审视越狱方法。请注意，许多现有的推理算法都可以被纳入这种表述框架。例如，思维链提示可以通过从 LLM 中反复生成部分思维并将其附加到 SSitalic_S 来实现。最终答案是通过将更新后的 SSitalic_S 传递给同一个 LLM 生成的。类似地，在越狱文献中，如 PAIR（Chao 等人，2024b）等方法旨在通过在每次迭代中更新 SSitalic_S 来求解(3.1)，附加攻击者生成的思维链和目标模型的响应。字符串 SSitalic_S 封装了攻击过程中执行的所有部分指令和中间步骤。

Prior semantic-space jailbreaking methods have often used prompted or fine-tuned LLMs (Chao et al., 2024b; Mehrotra et al., 2024; Mazeika et al., 2024) as judges to evaluate whether a jailbreak is successful. These judges are the simplest “verifiers”: once the refinement of S𝑆Sitalic_S is over, the judge will evaluate if 𝔸⁢(S)𝔸𝑆\mathbb{A}(S)blackboard_A ( italic_S ) is a successful jailbreak. However, the judge only provides a binary signal: whether or not jailbreaking has taken place. This makes binary verifiers unsuitable for estimating intermediate rewards. To alleviate this, we use a continuous and more informative loss function. A loss function will provide more granular feedback by assigning smaller loss values to prompts that are semantically closer to eliciting the desired behavior from 𝕋𝕋\mathbb{T}blackboard_T. Following prior work (Zou et al., 2023; Hayase et al., 2024), we use the cross-entropy loss of a particular affirmative string for each intent (e.g., “Sure, here is the step-by-step instructions for building a bomb”), measuring how likely the target model is to begin with that string. Showing this desired string as 𝐲I={y1,y2,⋯,yl}subscript𝐲𝐼subscript𝑦1subscript𝑦2⋯subscript𝑦𝑙\mathbf{y}_{I}=\{y_{1},y_{2},\cdots,y_{l}\}bold_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }, our goal is to optimize the following next-word prediction loss:
先前的语义空间越狱方法通常使用提示或微调的 LLMs（Chao 等人，2024b；Mehrotra 等人，2024；Mazeika 等人，2024）作为裁判来评估越狱是否成功。这些裁判是最简单的“验证器”：一旦 SSitalic_S 的优化完成，裁判将评估 𝔸⁢(S)\mathbb{A}(S)blackboard_A ( italic_S ) 是否为成功的越狱。然而，裁判只提供二进制信号：是否发生了越狱。这使得二进制验证器不适用于估计中间奖励。为了缓解这一问题，我们使用一个连续且更信息丰富的损失函数。损失函数通过为在语义上更接近于从 𝕋\mathbb{T}blackboard_T 中引出期望行为的提示分配较小的损失值，提供更细粒度的反馈。遵循先前的工作（Zou 等人，2023；Hayase 等人，2024），我们对每个意图使用特定肯定字符串的交叉熵损失（例如，“当然，以下是制作炸弹的逐步说明”），测量目标模型开始使用该字符串的可能性。将此期望字符串显示为 𝐲I={y1,y2,⋯,yl}subscriptsubscript1subscript2subscript\mathbf{y}_{I}=\{y_{1},y_{2},\cdots,y_{l}\}bold_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } ，我们的目标是优化以下下一个词预测损失：

ℒ𝕋⁢(P,𝐲I)subscriptℒ𝕋𝑃subscript𝐲𝐼\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\rm\mathbb{T}}(P,\mathbf{y}_{I})caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_P , bold_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =−log⁡(ℙ𝕋⁢(y1,…,yl|P))absentsubscriptℙ𝕋subscript𝑦1…conditionalsubscript𝑦𝑙𝑃\displaystyle=-\log\big{(}\mathbb{P}_{\rm\mathbb{T}}(y_{1},\dots,y_{l}|P)\big{)}= - roman_log ( blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_P ) )
=−∑i=1llog⁡(ℙ𝕋⁢(yi|[P,y1:i−1])).absentsuperscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑙subscriptℙ𝕋conditionalsubscript𝑦𝑖𝑃subscript𝑦:1𝑖1\displaystyle=-\sum_{i=1}^{l}\log\big{(}\mathbb{P}_{\rm\mathbb{T}}(y_{i}|[P,y_% {1:i-1}])\big{)}.= - ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log ( blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | [ italic_P , italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] ) ) . (3.2)

This function can be calculated by reading the log-prob vectors of the target model. Utilizing this loss function as our process reward model, we must refine the reasoning string S𝑆Sitalic_S such that:
这个函数可以通过读取目标模型的 log-prob 向量来计算。利用这个损失函数作为我们的过程奖励模型，我们必须优化推理字符串 SSitalic_S ，使其满足：

minS⁡ℒ𝕋⁢(𝔸⁢(S),𝐲I).subscript𝑆subscriptℒ𝕋𝔸𝑆subscript𝐲𝐼\displaystyle\min\limits_{S}\ \mathcal{L}_{\rm\mathbb{T}}(\mathbb{A}(S),% \mathbf{y}_{I}).roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( blackboard_A ( italic_S ) , bold_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) . (3.3)

In what follows, we will propose principled reasoning-based methodologies to solve the above optimization. We will use the loss values to guide our search and verification processes. Importantly, our methods are gradient-free, meaning that we only compute the loss through forward passes, and not the gradient of the loss with respect to the input. In technical terms, we only utilize bandit information from the loss as opposed to first-order information.
接下来，我们将提出基于推理的原则性方法来解决上述优化问题。我们将使用损失值来指导我们的搜索和验证过程。重要的是，我们的方法是梯度无关的，这意味着我们仅通过前向传递计算损失，而不是计算损失相对于输入的梯度。从技术角度来说，我们仅利用损失中的 bandit 信息，而不是一阶信息。

4 Algorithm  4 算法

Optimization over the reasoning string.
推理字符串上的优化。

We must find a reasoning string S𝑆Sitalic_S for an attacker LLM 𝔸𝔸\mathbb{A}blackboard_A such that the resulting prompt P:=𝔸⁢(S)assign𝑃𝔸𝑆P:=\mathbb{A}(S)italic_P := blackboard_A ( italic_S ) jailbreaks the target LLM. Our algorithm iteratively refines S𝑆Sitalic_S, aiming to minimize the loss given in Equation 3.3. Starting from a root node S(0)superscript𝑆0S^{(0)}italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT–a predefined template in Appendix D–we iteratively construct a reasoning tree with nodes representing candidate strings (see Figure 1). At iteration t𝑡titalic_t, a node in the tree with the best score is selected. This node will expand into m𝑚mitalic_m children S1(t+1),⋯,Sm(t+1)subscriptsuperscript𝑆𝑡11⋯subscriptsuperscript𝑆𝑡1𝑚S^{(t+1)}_{1},\cdots,S^{(t+1)}_{m}italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. The tree will be further pruned at each iteration to retain a buffer of the best nodes. We now explain this process in detail, beginning with a description of an individual reasoning step in our method.

Let ℓ1,⋯,ℓnsubscriptℓ1⋯subscriptℓ𝑛\ell_{1},\cdots,\ell_{n}roman_ℓ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , roman_ℓ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be the loss values obtained from Section 3 for P1,⋯,Pnsubscript𝑃1⋯subscript𝑃𝑛P_{1},\cdots,P_{n}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, respectively. Examples of feedback strings F𝐹Fitalic_F are illustrated in Figure 2, where P1subscript𝑃1P_{1}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT with a role-play scenario has a lower loss, so Feedback LLM highlights this observation for use as an extra instruction in the next iteration.
反馈字符串 FFitalic_F 的示例在图 2 中说明，其中具有角色扮演场景的 P1subscript1P_{1}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT 具有较低的损失，因此反馈 LLM 突出了这一观察结果，以在下一轮迭代中用作额外的指令。

Applying the feedback via a refiner.
通过一个精炼器应用反馈。

Once the feedback is obtained, the reasoning string must be refined and updated into its children. One way to do this is to append the feedback to the reasoning string at each time. This quickly becomes intractable—not only does the string length grow with each iteration, but also the set of different feedbacks can contradict each other. Instead, we deploy a Refiner LLM ℝℝ\mathbb{R}blackboard_R inspired by the idea of “textual gradients” introduced in (Yuksekgonul et al., 2024). Taking S(t)superscript𝑆𝑡S^{(t)}italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and the feedback string F𝐹Fitalic_F as its arguments, ℝℝ\mathbb{R}blackboard_R generates a new reasoning string S(t+1)superscript𝑆𝑡1S^{(t+1)}italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT that refines S(t)superscript𝑆𝑡S^{(t)}italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT based on the feedback:
一旦获得反馈，推理字符串必须被精炼并更新到其子节点中。一种方法是在每次迭代时将反馈附加到推理字符串上。这很快变得难以处理——不仅字符串长度随着每次迭代而增长，而且不同的反馈集合也可能相互矛盾。相反，我们部署了一个 Refiner LLM ℝ\mathbb{R}blackboard_R ，它借鉴了(Yuksekgonul 等人，2024)中引入的“文本梯度”的概念。以 S(t)superscriptS^{(t)}italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 和反馈字符串 FFitalic_F 作为其参数， ℝ\mathbb{R}blackboard_R 生成一个新的推理字符串 S(t+1)superscript1S^{(t+1)}italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ，该字符串根据反馈精炼 S(t)superscriptS^{(t)}italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ：

S(t+1)=ℝ⁢(S(t),F).superscript𝑆𝑡1ℝsuperscript𝑆𝑡𝐹S^{(t+1)}=\mathbb{R}(S^{(t)},F).italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = blackboard_R ( italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_F ) . (4.2)

Replicating the above process (Feedback+Refine) m𝑚mitalic_m times in parallel, we have m𝑚mitalic_m new reasoning strings {S1(t+1),⋯,Sm(t+1)}subscriptsuperscript𝑆𝑡11⋯subscriptsuperscript𝑆𝑡1𝑚\{S^{(t+1)}_{1},\cdots,S^{(t+1)}_{m}\}{ italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } as the children of S(t)superscript𝑆𝑡S^{(t)}italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Figure 2 shows a single iteration of our method and illustrates how the updated reasoning string incorporates the key components of the feedback. Note that rather than relying on the attacker’s CoT process—which lacks any information about the loss function—we explicitly engineer the reasoning steps aiming to decrease the loss function. This setup parallels recent efforts that align a model’s intermediate steps with predefined strategies (Wang et al., 2024b; Xiang et al., 2025).
复制上述过程（反馈+优化） mmitalic_m 次并行执行，我们得到 mmitalic_m 个新的推理字符串 {S1(t+1),⋯,Sm(t+1)}subscriptsuperscript11subscriptsuperscript1\{S^{(t+1)}_{1},\cdots,S^{(t+1)}_{m}\}{ italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } 作为 S(t)superscriptS^{(t)}italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 的子节点。图 2 展示了我们方法的一次迭代，并说明了更新后的推理字符串如何结合反馈的关键组件。请注意，我们并非依赖攻击者的思维链过程——该过程缺乏任何关于损失函数的信息——而是明确设计推理步骤以降低损失函数。这种设置与近期将模型的中间步骤与预定义策略对齐的努力相平行（Wang 等人，2024b；Xiang 等人，2025）。

Verifier.  验证器。

Next, to quantify the quality of each reasoning string, we assign a score using the loss function in Equation 3.3. For a given reasoning string S𝑆Sitalic_S, we define the verifier’s score as:
接下来，为了量化每个推理字符串的质量，我们使用方程 3.3 中的损失函数为其分配一个分数。对于给定的推理字符串 SSitalic_S ，我们将验证器的分数定义为：

where P1,⋯,Pnsubscript𝑃1⋯subscript𝑃𝑛{P_{1},\cdots,P_{n}}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are the attacking prompts generated from S𝑆Sitalic_S. The minimization reflects the adversarial nature of the problem. Specifically, each reasoning string is evaluated based on the most effective attacking prompt it produces as finding a single successful attacking prompt suffices.
P1,⋯,Pnsubscript1subscript{P_{1},\cdots,P_{n}}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT 是从 SSitalic_S 生成的攻击提示。最小化反映了问题的对抗性。具体来说，每个推理字符串都是根据它产生的最有效的攻击提示进行评估的，因为找到一个成功的攻击提示就足够了。

Searching method.  搜索方法。

We now describe the node selection and pruning process based on the verifier’s score. Inspired by the Go-with-the-Winners algorithm (Aldous & Vazirani, 1994) and Greedy Coordinate Query (Hayase et al., 2024), our method maintains a priority buffer of reasoning strings with the highest scores according to Equation 4.3, pruning those with lower scores (i.e., strings that generate attacking prompts with high loss). The buffer is denoted as L𝐿Litalic_L in Algorithm 1 with a size of B𝐵Bitalic_B. At each iteration, the highest-scoring node in the buffer is selected for expansion, and its m𝑚mitalic_m children are added to the buffer. The buffer is then pruned to retain only the top B𝐵Bitalic_B candidates. This pruning strategy enables backtracking when none of the children exceed the scores of existing buffer candidates. Algorithm 1 outlines these steps. In line 4, the reasoning string is initialized with a template and iteratively updated to generate new attacking prompts. This process repeats for T𝑇Titalic_T iterations.
我们现在基于验证者的分数来描述节点选择和剪枝过程。受 Go-with-the-Winners 算法（Aldous & Vazirani, 1994）和 Greedy Coordinate Query（Hayase 等人，2024）的启发，我们的方法维护一个优先级缓冲区，其中包含根据公式 4.3 得分最高的推理字符串，剪枝那些得分较低（即生成具有高损失的攻击性提示的字符串）。该缓冲区在算法 1 中用 LLitalic_L 表示，大小为 BBitalic_B 。在每次迭代中，从缓冲区中选择得分最高的节点进行扩展，并将其 mmitalic_m 个子节点添加到缓冲区中。然后对缓冲区进行剪枝，仅保留前 BBitalic_B 个候选节点。这种剪枝策略在没有任何子节点的得分超过现有缓冲区候选节点得分时，能够实现回溯。算法 1 概述了这些步骤。在第 4 行，推理字符串使用模板初始化，并迭代更新以生成新的攻击性提示。这个过程重复 TTitalic_T 次。

5 Experiments  5 实验

Baselines and Evaluations.
基线与评估。

We compare our algorithm with state-of-the-art methods for jailbreaking in both the token-space and the semantic-space. Specifically, we include GCG (Zou et al., 2023), PAIR (Chao et al., 2024b), TAP-T (Mehrotra et al., 2024), Rainbow Teaming (Samvelyan et al., 2024), and AutoDAN-turbo (Liu et al., 2024a) which is an extension of AutoDAN (Liu et al., 2024b). Additionally, we incorporate results from (Andriushchenko et al., 2024a), even though some of their methods go beyond just modifying the target LLM’s input and employ pre-filling attacks or alter the target model’s system prompt. As we limit our comparison to methods that interact with the target LLM through its input, we use only their crafted template along with random search, which we refer to as “Adaptive Attack”. We use Attack Success Rate (ASR) as the main metric for comparison. We execute our algorithm against some of the safest LLMs including both open-source (white-box) and proprietary (black-box) models. The HarmBench judge (Mazeika et al., 2024) is deployed to evaluate the target LLM’s responses due to its high alignment with human evaluations (Souly et al., 2024; Chao et al., 2024a). We test our algorithm on 50 uniformly sampled tasks selected from standard behaviors in the Harmbench dataset (Mazeika et al., 2024). We manually verify all proposed jailbreaks to avoid false positives. (Read Appendix B for more details about verification.)
我们将我们的算法与在标记空间和语义空间中进行越狱攻击的当前最先进方法进行比较。具体来说，我们包括了 GCG（Zou 等人，2023）、PAIR（Chao 等人，2024b）、TAP-T（Mehrotra 等人，2024）、Rainbow Teaming（Samvelyan 等人，2024）以及 AutoDAN-turbo（Liu 等人，2024a），后者是 AutoDAN（Liu 等人，2024b）的扩展。此外，我们还纳入了（Andriushchenko 等人，2024a）的结果，尽管他们的一些方法不仅限于修改目标 LLM 的输入，还采用了预填充攻击或修改目标模型的系统提示。由于我们将比较限制在通过输入与目标 LLM 交互的方法，我们仅使用他们设计的模板结合随机搜索，这被称为“自适应攻击”。我们使用攻击成功率（ASR）作为主要的比较指标。我们针对一些最安全的 LLM 执行我们的算法，包括开源（白盒）和专有（黑盒）模型。 HarmBench 裁判（Mazeika 等人，2024 年）被用于评估目标 LLM 的响应，因为它与人类评估高度一致（Souly 等人，2024 年；Chao 等人，2024a）。我们在从 Harmbench 数据集的标准行为中均匀采样的 50 个任务上测试我们的算法（Mazeika 等人，2024 年）。我们手动验证所有提出的越狱方法以避免误报。（有关验证的更多详细信息，请参阅附录 B。)

Attacker models As for the attacker model, we use LLMs without any moderation mechanism to ensure compliance. Specifically, we use “Vicuna-13b-v1.5” (Vicuna) and “Mixtral-8x7B-v0.1” (Mixtral) (Mistral AI, 2024). The details of our curated system prompt for the attacker are given in Appendix D. The temperature of the attacker LLM is set to 1.0, as exploration is critical in our framework.
攻击者模型 关于攻击者模型，我们使用没有任何审核机制的 LLMs 以确保合规性。具体来说，我们使用“Vicuna-13b-v1.5”（Vicuna）和“Mixtral-8x7B-v0.1”（Mixtral）（Mistral AI，2024 年）。攻击者使用的定制系统提示的详细信息见附录 D。攻击者 LLM 的温度设置为 1.0，因为在我们的框架中探索至关重要。

Feedback LLM and Refiner LLM. For a fair comparison with other attacker-based methods, we use the same model for the Feedback LLM, Refiner LLM, and attacker model, as they are all part of the attacking team. This setup isolates the effect of each method from differences in model capability. Details of their configuration and the rationale behind these choices are in Appendix D. At each call of Feedback LLM, we divide the n𝑛nitalic_n sorted attacking prompts into k𝑘kitalic_k buckets and uniformly sample one prompt from each bucket. Feedback LLM then evaluates only n/k𝑛𝑘n/kitalic_n / italic_k prompts at a time. This strategy facilitates exploration in the search algorithm by increasing the diversity of feedback. While the prompt with the lowest loss is more likely to succeed in jailbreaking, comparing the other prompts can provide more informative feedback and enhance the overall effectiveness of the optimization process.
反馈 LLM 和精炼 LLM。为了与其他基于攻击者的方法进行公平比较，我们使用相同的模型作为反馈 LLM、精炼 LLM 和攻击模型，因为它们都属于攻击团队。这种设置隔离了每种方法的效果，避免了模型能力差异的影响。它们的配置细节以及这些选择背后的理由在附录 D 中。在每次调用反馈 LLM 时，我们将 nnitalic_n 排序的攻击提示分成 kkitalic_k 个桶，并从每个桶中均匀地采样一个提示。反馈 LLM 每次只评估 n/kn/kitalic_n / italic_k 个提示。这种策略通过增加反馈的多样性来促进搜索算法中的探索。虽然损失最低的提示更有可能在越狱中成功，但比较其他提示可以提供更有信息的反馈，并提高优化过程的整体有效性。

Hyperparameters. Unless otherwise specified, we set the temperature of the target model to 00. We execute our algorithm for T=15𝑇15T=15italic_T = 15 iterations per task. At each iteration, we query the current reasoning string in n=16𝑛16n=16italic_n = 16 separate streams to obtain the attacking prompts. For feedback generation, we use bucket size k=2𝑘2k=2italic_k = 2 and we generate m=8𝑚8m=8italic_m = 8 feedbacks. For each generated feedback we will have m=8𝑚8m=8italic_m = 8 new reasoning string candidates that will be added to the buffer. The buffer size for the list of candidate reasoning strings is B=32𝐵32B=32italic_B = 32. This setting yields a total of 240 target LLM queries and m×(T−1)×n=1920𝑚𝑇1𝑛1920m\times(T-1)\times n=1920italic_m × ( italic_T - 1 ) × italic_n = 1920 auto-regression steps (for calculating the loss in Section 3) per task. These hyperparameters were selected by testing a handful of candidates empirically (for example, m=8𝑚8m=8italic_m = 8 generally outperformed m=4𝑚4m=4italic_m = 4 in loss reduction).
超参数。除非另有说明，我们将目标模型的温度设置为 00 。我们每个任务执行 T=1515T=15italic_T = 15 次迭代。在每次迭代中，我们通过 n=1616n=16italic_n = 16 个独立的流查询当前的推理字符串以获取攻击提示。对于反馈生成，我们使用桶大小 k=22k=2italic_k = 2 ，并生成 m=88m=8italic_m = 8 条反馈。对于每条生成的反馈，我们将获得 m=88m=8italic_m = 8 个新的推理字符串候选，这些候选将被添加到缓冲区中。候选推理字符串列表的缓冲区大小为 B=3232B=32italic_B = 32 。此设置每个任务产生总共 240 次目标 LLM 查询和 m×(T−1)×n=192011920m\times(T-1)\times n=1920italic_m × ( italic_T - 1 ) × italic_n = 1920 次自回归步骤（用于计算第 3 节中的损失）。这些超参数是通过经验测试少量候选者选定的（例如， m=88m=8italic_m = 8 通常在损失减少方面优于 m=44m=4italic_m = 4 ）。

5.1 Attack Success Rate  5.1 攻击成功率

In this section, we present our results on white-box target LLMs that permit direct access to log-prob vectors—essential for calculating our loss function given in (3). Results for black-box models are given in Section 5.2.
在本节中，我们展示了针对允许直接访问对数概率向量的白盒目标 LLM 的结果——这对于根据公式（3）计算我们的损失函数至关重要。黑盒模型的结果在 5.2 节中给出。

For all methods that rely on an attacker LLM to generate the attacking prompts we deploy Mixtral111Note that the standard versions of PAIR and TAP-T use Vicuna. The use of a stronger model such as Mixtral here leads to a higher ASR than their reported results.
请注意，PAIR 和 TAP-T 的标准版本使用 Vicuna。这里使用更强的模型 Mixtral 导致的 ASR 比他们报告的结果更高。
对于所有依赖攻击型 LLM 生成攻击提示的方法，我们部署了 Mixtral 1 . The main results are presented in Table 1. Except for Llama-3-8B, our method achieves the best ASR among both the token-space and the semantic-space attempts. Notably, token-space algorithms operate without constraints to be semantically meaningful, thereby facilitating the search for a jailbreaking prompt. However, as shown in Table 1, for target models that have been adversarially trained against token-level jailbreaking such as Llama-3-8B-RR (Zou et al., 2024) and R2D2 (Mazeika et al., 2024), these algorithms largely fail as they rely on eliciting only a few tokens. In Appendix E, we provide jailbreak examples and details of how our algorithm works w.r.t. those examples in Figures 10 and 11.
。主要结果展示在表 1 中。除了 Llama-3-8B，我们的方法在 token 空间和语义空间尝试中均实现了最佳 ASR。值得注意的是，token 空间算法不受语义意义的约束，从而有助于寻找越狱提示。然而，如表 1 所示，对于经过对抗性训练以抵抗 token 级越狱的目标模型（如 Llama-3-8B-RR（Zou 等人，2024）和 R2D2（Mazeika 等人，2024）），这些算法大多失效，因为它们仅依赖于引出少数几个 token。在附录 E 中，我们提供了越狱示例以及我们的算法在这些示例中如何工作的详细说明，如图 10 和 11 所示。

Additionally, in Table 2, we compare the average of overall queries per success among all the baselines. Although AutoDAN-Turbo and Rainbow Teaming require few evaluation-time prompts, they involve extensive upfront computation to identify initial strategies, so this should be incorporated into any comparison. While our method does require more queries than PAIR, it achieves higher success rates on difficult tasks that demand multiple refinement steps. In this manner, another useful comparison is the one provided in Figure 5 where we compare the number of jailbreaks at each iteration for both algorithms.
此外，在表 2 中，我们比较了所有基线方法在成功情况下每成功的平均查询次数。尽管 AutoDAN-Turbo 和 Rainbow Teaming 在评估时需要的提示较少，但它们需要大量的前期计算来识别初始策略，因此这应该被纳入任何比较中。虽然我们的方法比 PAIR 需要更多的查询，但它能在需要多个精炼步骤的困难任务上实现更高的成功率。以这种方式，另一个有用的比较是图 5 中提供的比较，我们比较了两种算法在每次迭代中的越狱次数。

Different attackers.  不同的攻击者。

The ASR of all the algorithms that rely on an LLM for generating the attacking prompts varies by the capabilities of that LLM. These capabilities, however, can be improved by scaling the test-time computation (Snell et al., 2024). We demonstrate the efficacy of our algorithm by using a weaker attacker model such as Vicuna. We compare the ASR of our algorithm to those of PAIR (Chao et al., 2024b) and TAP-T (Mehrotra et al., 2024), all targeting Llama-3-8B. As shown in Table 3, our algorithm achieves an ASR of 64%percent6464\%64 % with Vicuna—more than three times the ASR achieved by PAIR and TAP-T. Notably, it nearly attains the same ASR as PAIR with Mixtral as the attacker– a much stronger LLM than Vicuna. Furthermore, our method uses a very simple system prompt for the attacker LLM (see Appendix D) compared to methods such as PAIR and TAP-T. This highlights the effectiveness of optimally scaling test-time computation rather than scaling the model. This aligns with a broader trend in the reasoning literature (Snell et al., 2024).
所有依赖 LLM 生成攻击提示的算法的 ASR 因该 LLM 的能力而异。然而，这些能力可以通过扩展测试时计算来提升（Snell 等人，2024）。我们通过使用较弱的攻击者模型（如 Vicuna）来展示我们算法的有效性。我们将我们算法的 ASR 与针对 Llama-3-8B 的 PAIR（Chao 等人，2024b）和 TAP-T（Mehrotra 等人，2024）进行比较。如表 3 所示，我们的算法在 Vicuna 上实现了 64%percent6464\%64 % 的 ASR，这比 PAIR 和 TAP-T 实现的 ASR 高出三倍多。值得注意的是，当使用 Mixtral 作为攻击者时，它的 ASR 几乎与 PAIR 相同——Mixtral 是一个比 Vicuna 强得多的 LLM。此外，与 PAIR 和 TAP-T 等方法相比，我们的方法为攻击者 LLM 使用了一个非常简单的系统提示（见附录 D）。这突出了优化扩展测试时计算的有效性，而不是扩展模型。这与推理文献中的更广泛趋势一致（Snell 等人，2024）。

5.2 Multi-shot transfer attacks
5.2 多示例迁移攻击

Given the infeasibility of obtaining the log-prob vectors in black-box models, we evaluate the success of our algorithm using two transfer methods. We perform the transfer by optimizing the loss function on a surrogate white-box model and then applying the derived adversarial prompt to the target black-box model. A common approach is to transfer the prompt that jailbreaks or yields the lowest loss on the surrogate model (Zou et al., 2023)—we call this a “one-shot” transfer attack. However, this does not always result in an effective attack as the loss function serves only as a heuristic in the transfer. We improve effectiveness by using a scheme that queries the target model with all the attacking prompts collected from executing the algorithm (n𝑛nitalic_n prompts per iteration). We call this a “multi-shot” transfer. We show that the transfer success significantly increases with this scheme. We use the loss values from three white-box models: Llama-2, Llama-3-RR, and R2D2 as the surrogate loss in our algorithm in Section 4 to conduct attacks on black-box models. (Zou et al., 2023) demonstrates that aggregating losses from multiple target models enhances the transferability of the final prompt compared to relying on a single model. If we have surrogate models 𝕄1,…,𝕄rsubscript𝕄1…subscript𝕄𝑟\mathbb{M}_{1},\dots,\mathbb{M}_{r}blackboard_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , blackboard_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, the aggregated loss function is 1r⁢∑i=1rℒ𝕄i⁢(P,𝐲I)1𝑟superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑟subscriptℒsubscript𝕄𝑖𝑃subscript𝐲𝐼\frac{1}{r}\sum_{i=1}^{r}\mathcal{L}_{\mathbb{M}_{i}}(P,\mathbf{y}_{I})divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_r end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_P , bold_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), where each loss is calculated according to Section 3. We run Algorithm 1 with this loss to evaluate the attacking prompts, and to assign the scores in Equation 4.3. We assess the effectiveness of using the aggregated loss as the surrogate for r=3𝑟3r=3italic_r = 3 using the mentioned above models. Details of our transfer method using r𝑟ritalic_r models for surrogate loss estimation are presented in Algorithm 2.
鉴于在黑盒模型中无法获取对数概率向量，我们使用两种迁移方法来评估我们算法的成功率。我们通过在替代白盒模型上优化损失函数，然后将得到的对抗性提示应用于目标黑盒模型来进行迁移。一种常见的方法是迁移在替代模型上能够越狱或产生最低损失的提示（Zou 等人，2023 年）——我们称这种方法为“单次”迁移攻击。然而，这并不总是能产生有效的攻击，因为损失函数在迁移中仅作为启发式方法使用。我们通过使用一种查询目标模型的方法来提高有效性，该方法收集了从执行算法过程中获得的所有攻击提示（每轮迭代 nnitalic_n 个提示）。我们称这种方法为“多次”迁移。我们证明，使用这种方案可以显著提高迁移成功率。在第四节中，我们使用来自三个白盒模型（Llama-2、Llama-3-RR 和 R2D2）的损失值作为算法中的替代损失，对黑盒模型进行攻击。 (Zou 等人，2023)表明，从多个目标模型聚合损失相比于依赖单个模型，能够增强最终提示的迁移性。如果我们有替代模型 𝕄1,…,𝕄rsubscript1subscript\mathbb{M}_{1},\dots,\mathbb{M}_{r}blackboard_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , blackboard_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ，聚合损失函数是 1r⁢∑i=1rℒ𝕄i⁢(P,𝐲I)1superscriptsubscript1subscriptsubscriptsubscript\frac{1}{r}\sum_{i=1}^{r}\mathcal{L}_{\mathbb{M}_{i}}(P,\mathbf{y}_{I})divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_r end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_P , bold_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ，其中每个损失根据第 3 节计算。我们使用这个损失运行算法 1 来评估攻击提示，并分配方程 4.3 中的分数。我们使用上述模型评估将聚合损失作为 r=33r=3italic_r = 3 替代的效果。我们使用替代模型 rritalic_r 进行替代损失估计的迁移方法的细节在算法 2 中呈现。

Table 4 presents the results of our experiments in comparing “one-shot” and “multi-shot” settings. The multi-shot approach significantly improves the ASR across all tested models, with the exception of Cygnet (Zou et al., 2024). Cygnet, a variant of Llama-3-RR, incorporates a strict safety filter that blocked almost all of our attempts. Indeed, the success rate of any other jailbreaking algorithm is near zero for Cygnet (Zou et al., 2024); therefore, our findings demonstrate a higher ASR compared to existing literature. Notably, we achieve 94% on Llama-3.1-405B (without Llama Guard) (Meta AI, 2024), 94% on GPT4o, and 66% on Gemini-1.5-pro. For models with stricter moderation mechanisms, such as OpenAI o1-preview and Claude-3.5-Sonnet, using the average loss boosts the ASR. For instance, (OpenAI, 2024b) reports an ASR of 16% for the o1-preview model. Using our attack, this increases to 56%. Further details about the transfer experimental setup are provided in Appendix B. Figure 6 presents the vulnerabilities of different models across the six categories in Harmbench.
表 4 展示了我们在“单次”和“多次”设置中比较实验的结果。多次方法显著提高了所有测试模型的语音识别率，除了 Cygnet（Zou 等人，2024）。Cygnet 是 Llama-3-RR 的一个变体，它包含一个严格的安全过滤器，几乎阻止了我们所有的尝试。实际上，对于 Cygnet（Zou 等人，2024），任何其他越狱算法的成功率都接近于零；因此，我们的研究结果与现有文献相比显示出更高的语音识别率。值得注意的是，我们在 Llama-3.1-405B（不使用 Llama Guard）（Meta AI，2024）上达到了 94%，在 GPT4o 上达到了 94%，在 Gemini-1.5-pro 上达到了 66%。对于具有更严格审核机制的模式，如 OpenAI o1-preview 和 Claude-3.5-Sonnet，使用平均损失可以提高语音识别率。例如，（OpenAI，2024b）报告 o1-preview 模型的语音识别率为 16%。使用我们的攻击，这一比率增加到 56%。有关迁移实验设置的更多详细信息，请参见附录 B。图 6 展示了不同模型在 Harmbench 的六个类别中的漏洞。

DeepSeek-R1 evaluation We evaluate DeepSeek-R1 (DeepSeek-AI, 2025) using the aggregated surrogate loss. Our approach achieves 100% ASR, indicating that Deepseek fails to block a single adversarial reasoning attack. This outcome suggests that lacks robust guardrails, making it highly susceptible to algorithmic jailbreaking.
DeepSeek-R1 评估 我们使用聚合代理损失评估 DeepSeek-R1（DeepSeek-AI，2025）。我们的方法实现了 100%的 ASR，表明 Deepseek 未能阻止任何一次对抗性推理攻击。这一结果表明其缺乏稳健的防护措施，使其极易受到算法越狱攻击。

5.3 Ablation studies  5.3 消融研究

We examine whether our method (i) minimizes the loss function; and (ii) relies on the feedback string for its effectiveness. Furthermore, we show that it uncovers more jailbreaks in later iterations than prior work.
我们检验了我们的方法（i）是否最小化损失函数；以及（ii）是否依赖反馈字符串来发挥其有效性。此外，我们展示了它在后续迭代中比先前工作发现了更多的越狱攻击。

Effective loss minimization.
有效的损失最小化。

Our algorithm aims to optimize a loss function defined over a string. To assess its effectiveness, we can probe 𝕍⁢(S)𝕍𝑆\mathbb{V}(S)blackboard_V ( italic_S ) in Equation 4.3 over iterations. Figure 3 illustrates this loss progression for various targets with Mixtral as the attacker and averaged over 50 tasks. The results showcase a quantitative decrease in the minimum loss for all target models until approximately the 10th iteration, after which the loss exhibits slight oscillations. Notably, for R2D2, the loss converges to zero despite the safety measures. As depicted in Figure 3, the loss curve for Llama-3-8B-RR shows a significant gap compared to what its fine-tuned from, Llama-3-8B, and despite this gap, our algorithm achieves 44%percent4444\%44 % of ASR. To investigate this, we plot the loss separately for successful and failed jailbreaking attempts in Figure 3. This figure shows that, on average, successful attempts depict lower loss values than failures. This demonstrates the utility of Section 3 as a heuristic; Although the absolute loss value may remain high, its relative value serves as an informative metric. Unsurprisingly, the jailbreaks do not begin with their desired output string 𝐲Isubscript𝐲𝐼\mathbf{y}_{I}bold_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for Llama-3-8B-RR. However, in Appendix E, we show that there are other possibilities such as initially refusing followed by compliance. Figure 3 helps us establish our work as an attack in the prompt space that effectively optimizes a loss, similar to algorithms in the token-space, but with significantly fewer number of iterations. The number of iterations for the token-space algorithms can be as high as 104superscript10410^{4}10 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 4 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (Andriushchenko et al., 2024a).
我们的算法旨在优化一个定义在字符串上的损失函数。为了评估其有效性，我们可以迭代探测方程式 4.3 中的 𝕍⁢(S)\mathbb{V}(S)blackboard_V ( italic_S ) 。图 3 展示了不同目标模型的损失进展情况，其中 Mixtral 作为攻击者，并平均了 50 个任务的结果。结果表明，在迭代到大约第 10 次时，所有目标模型的最低损失呈现定量下降，之后损失值出现轻微振荡。值得注意的是，对于 R2D2，尽管采取了安全措施，损失值仍收敛为零。如图 3 所示，Llama-3-8B-RR 的损失曲线与其微调前的 Llama-3-8B 相比存在显著差距，但即便如此，我们的算法仍实现了 44%percent4444\%44 % 的 ASR。为了探究这一现象，我们在图 3 中分别绘制了成功和失败的越狱尝试的损失曲线。该图显示，成功的尝试平均损失值低于失败尝试。这证明了第 3 节的启发式作用；尽管绝对损失值可能仍然较高，但其相对值可作为信息量丰富的指标。毫不奇怪，Llama-3-8B-RR 的越狱尝试并未从其期望的输出字符串 𝐲Isubscript\mathbf{y}_{I}bold_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT 开始。 然而，在附录 E 中，我们展示了其他可能性，例如最初拒绝随后又服从。图 3 帮助我们确立我们的工作是在提示空间中的一次攻击，它有效地优化了损失，类似于标记空间中的算法，但迭代次数显著更少。标记空间算法的迭代次数可以高达 104superscript10410^{4}10 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 4 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT （Andriushchenko 等人，2024a）。

Loss-guided reasoning is essential
损失引导的推理是必不可少的

. We explicitly construct the adversarial reasoning steps (see Figure 2) to ensure the relevance of such directions to decreasing the loss. To highlight the importance of this design and its distinction from relying solely on intrinsic CoT capabilities of LLMs, we conducted an experiment using PAIR with Deepseek-R1 as the attacker. As Table 5 shows, even advanced reasoning models such as Deepseek struggle when operating heuristically, and without our structured reasoning algorithm and external supervision via the loss. This aligns with recent work by Kritz et al. (2025, Fig. 6), where OpenAI-o3 underperforms as the attacker. Our conclusion is that finding the relevant directions by acquiring the loss-based feedback string is necessary to jailbreak stronger models.
。我们明确构建了对抗性推理步骤（见图 2），以确保这些方向与降低损失的相关性。为了强调这种设计的重要性及其与仅依赖 LLMs 的内在思维链（CoT）能力的区别，我们使用 PAIR 和 Deepseek-R1 作为攻击者进行了一项实验。如表 5 所示，即使是 Deepseek 这样的高级推理模型在启发式操作时也面临困难，并且没有我们的结构化推理算法和通过损失的外部监督。这与 Kritz 等人最近的工作（2025 年，图 6）一致，其中 OpenAI-o3 作为攻击者表现不佳。我们的结论是，通过获取基于损失的反馈字符串来找到相关方向对于破解更强的模型是必要的。

Feedback consistency. We conduct an experiment to demonstrate how feedback shifts the attacker’s output distribution toward more effective attacking prompts. We show that applying the feedback increases the generation probability of attacking prompts with lower losses in subsequent iterations. We consider a feedback F𝐹Fitalic_F as consistent if the following constraint holds for it:

Figure 4 presents the average results across all calls for n=16𝑛16n=16italic_n = 16, showing that at each iteration, the curve roughly increases, with a slight decline in the last two prompts. This decline can be attributed to the "Lost in the Middle" effect, where models tend to focus more on the most recent text (Liu et al., 2023). Nonetheless, the value of the last two prompts do not fall below the value of the initial prompts, indicating that the generated feedback remains meaningful and not misleading. In Appendix C, We conduct two more experiments to shed more light on the functionality of Feedback LLM. As a sanity check, we demonstrate that the reversing the order of the given attacking prompts to the Feedback LLM leads to semantically reversed feedbacks, and a drop in the ASR due to moving in the wrong direction in the prompt space.

Distribution of jailbreaks.
越狱的分布。

The standard version of PAIR runs for only 3 iterations. We increased this number to T=15𝑇15T=15italic_T = 15, matching it with our algorithm. Both algorithms use Mixtral to attack Llama-2-7B. Figures 5(a) and 5(b) depict the number of tasks that are jailbroken at each iteration for PAIR and our algorithm, respectively. PAIR achieved only two additional successful jailbreaks after the third iteration, accounting for 11% of successful attempts. In contrast, our algorithm accomplished 37% of jailbreaks after the third iteration, demonstrating a more effective utilization of iterations. Distributions of jailbreaks for other models are presented in Figures 8 and 9. As anticipated, a higher percentage of jailbreaks occur in later iterations for models with stricter safety measures that necessitate more extensive search; for instance, 57% after the third iteration for Llama-3-8B-RR (Figure 8(a)). PAIR relies on the reasoning capabilities of the attacker LLM to modify subsequent attacking prompts. Therefore, after encountering a few refusals from the target model, PAIR tends to deviate from the original intent to avoid the refusals. A couple of examples of this phenomenon are presented in Appendix E.
标准版的 PAIR 仅运行 3 次迭代。我们将这个数字增加到 T=1515T=15italic_T = 15 ，以匹配我们的算法。两种算法都使用 Mixtral 来攻击 Llama-2-7B。图 5(a)和图 5(b)分别展示了 PAIR 和我们的算法在每次迭代中成功越狱的任务数量。PAIR 在第三次迭代后仅实现了两次额外的成功越狱，占成功尝试的 11%。相比之下，我们的算法在第三次迭代后完成了 37%的越狱，显示出更有效的迭代利用。其他模型的越狱分布如图 8 和图 9 所示。正如预期，对于需要更广泛搜索的具有更严格安全措施模型，越狱在后期迭代中发生的比例更高；例如，Llama-3-8B-RR 在第三次迭代后达到了 57%（图 8(a)）。PAIR 依赖于攻击者 LLM 的推理能力来修改后续的攻击提示。因此，在目标模型拒绝几次后，PAIR 倾向于偏离原始意图以避免拒绝。附录 E 中展示了一些这种现象的例子。

6 Conclusion  6 结论

This paper investigates the role of reasoning in AI safety, showing that defenses that simply trade reasoning for more compute overlook the fact that attackers may also leverage reasoning to bypass guardrails. This paper defines adversarial reasoning, demonstrates a practical implementation, and provides state-of-the-art results on attack success rate.
本文研究了推理在人工智能安全中的作用，表明那些仅用计算资源换取推理能力的防御措施忽视了攻击者也可能利用推理来绕过安全限制的事实。本文定义了对抗性推理，展示了其实际应用，并提供了攻击成功率方面的最新研究成果。

Our work points to new directions for understanding and improving language model security. By bridging reasoning frameworks with adversarial attacks, we have demonstrated how structured exploration of the prompt space can reveal vulnerabilities even in heavily defended models. This suggests that future work on model alignment may need to consider not just individual prompts but entire reasoning paths when developing robust defenses. The success of our transfer attack methodology also highlights the importance of considering multiple surrogate models when evaluating model security. Looking ahead, our findings point to several promising research directions, including developing more sophisticated reasoning-guided search strategies, exploring hybrid approaches that combine token-level and semantic-level optimization, and investigating how process-based rewards could be incorporated into defensive training. Finally, while our study has focused on textual LLMs, our framework can potentially be relevant to the broader class of LLM-driven agents (Andriushchenko et al., 2024b). In particular, our methods can be naturally extended to LLM-controlled robots (Liang et al., 2023; Karamcheti et al., 2023; Vemprala et al., 2024), web-based agents (Wu et al., 2024), and AI-powered search engines (Reuel et al., 2024). Recent work (Robey et al., 2024a) underscores this connection by demonstrating that vulnerabilities identified in textual models can be transferred to real-world scenarios.
我们的工作为理解和改进语言模型安全性指明了新的方向。通过将推理框架与对抗性攻击相结合，我们展示了如何通过结构化探索提示空间，即使在高度防御的模型中也能揭示漏洞。这表明，在开发强大的防御措施时，未来的模型对齐工作可能需要考虑不仅是单个提示，而是整个推理路径。我们迁移攻击方法的成功也突出了在评估模型安全性时考虑多个替代模型的重要性。展望未来，我们的发现指出了几个有前景的研究方向，包括开发更复杂的推理引导搜索策略，探索结合词元级和语义级优化的混合方法，以及研究如何将基于过程的奖励纳入防御性训练中。 最后，虽然我们的研究主要集中在文本 LLMs 上，但我们的框架有可能对更广泛的 LLM 驱动代理（Andriushchenko 等人，2024b）产生关联。特别是，我们的方法可以自然地扩展到由 LLM 控制的机器人（Liang 等人，2023；Karamcheti 等人，2023；Vemprala 等人，2024）、基于网络的代理（Wu 等人，2024）以及 AI 驱动的搜索引擎（Reuel 等人，2024）。近期的研究（Robey 等人，2024a）通过证明文本模型中发现的漏洞可以转移到现实场景中，强调了这种联系。

Impact Statement  影响声明

This paper presents work whose goal is to advance the field of Machine Learning. There are many potential societal consequences of our work, none which we feel must be specifically highlighted here.
本文介绍的工作目标是推进机器学习领域。我们的工作有许多潜在的社會后果，但其中没有我们认为需要在此特别强调的。

Appendix A Additional Related Work
附录 A 其他相关研究

Token-space Jailbreaking. Token-space attacks (Shin et al., 2020; Wen et al., 2023; Zou et al., 2023; Hayase et al., 2024; Andriushchenko et al., 2024a) modify the input at the token level to decrease some loss value. For example, the GCG algorithm (Zou et al., 2023), one of the first transferrable token-level attacks to achieve significant success rates on aligned models, uses the gradient of the loss to guide the greedy search. Subsequent work has refined this approach to obtain lower computational cost and improved effectiveness (Liao & Sun, 2024; Jia et al., 2024), including token-level modifications by other heuristics and without a gradient (Hayase et al., 2024) and random searches over cleverly chosen initial prompts (Andriushchenko et al., 2024a). We adopt the use of a loss function from these methods as a signal to inform how to navigate the prompt space for better jailbreaks while remaining gradient-free.
Token 空间越狱。Token 空间攻击（Shin 等人，2020；Wen 等人，2023；Zou 等人，2023；Hayase 等人，2024；Andriushchenko 等人，2024a）在 token 级别修改输入以降低某些损失值。例如，GCG 算法（Zou 等人，2023），作为首批在对齐模型上取得显著成功率的可迁移 token 级攻击之一，使用损失梯度来指导贪婪搜索。后续研究改进了这种方法，以获得更低的计算成本和更高的有效性（Liao & Sun，2024；Jia 等人，2024），包括其他启发式算法的 token 级修改以及无梯度（Hayase 等人，2024）和精心选择的初始提示的随机搜索（Andriushchenko 等人，2024a）。我们借鉴这些方法中的损失函数的使用，将其作为信号，以指导如何在保持无梯度的同时更好地导航提示空间以实现越狱。

Semantic-space Jailbreaking. These methods often rely on a "red-teaming" LLM to generate adversarial prompts (Perez et al., 2022; Wei et al., 2023a; Sadasivan et al., 2024; Chao et al., 2024b; Liu et al., 2024b; Mehrotra et al., 2024; Zeng et al., 2024; Samvelyan et al., 2024; Liu et al., 2024a). Methods such as PAIR (Chao et al., 2024b) deploy a separate LLM, called the "attacker", which uses a crafted system prompt to interact with the target LLM over multiple rounds and generate semantic jailbreaks; they operate in a black-box manner, requiring only the target’s outputs, and are highly transferrable (Chao et al., 2024b). Some other methods fine-tune a model to generate the attacking prompts (Perez et al., 2022; Ge et al., 2023; Zeng et al., 2024; Paulus et al., 2024; Beetham et al., 2024), though this demands substantial computational resources. Rather than fine-tuning, we rely on increased test-time computation (Snell et al., 2024), while others start from expert-crafted prompts (e.g., DAN) and refine them via genetic algorithms (Liu et al., 2024b; Samvelyan et al., 2024; Lapid et al., 2024). Like these methods, our approach generates semantically meaningful jailbreaks by using another LLM as the attacker, however, our approach is significantly different from the prior work as we develop reasoning modules based on the loss values to better navigate the prompt space.
语义空间越狱。这些方法通常依赖一个“红队”LLM 来生成对抗性提示（Perez 等人，2022 年；Wei 等人，2023a；Sadasivan 等人，2024 年；Chao 等人，2024b；Liu 等人，2024b；Mehrotra 等人，2024 年；Zeng 等人，2024 年；Samvelyan 等人，2024 年；Liu 等人，2024a）。例如，PAIR（Chao 等人，2024b）部署了一个单独的 LLM，称为“攻击者”，它使用一个定制的系统提示在多轮中与目标 LLM 交互并生成语义越狱；它们以黑盒方式运行，只需要目标的输出，并且高度可迁移（Chao 等人，2024b）。其他一些方法通过微调模型来生成攻击性提示（Perez 等人，2022 年；Ge 等人，2023 年；Zeng 等人，2024 年；Paulus 等人，2024 年；Beetham 等人，2024 年），尽管这需要大量的计算资源。 与其进行微调，我们依赖于增加测试时的计算量（Snell 等人，2024 年），而其他人则从专家设计的提示（例如，DAN）开始，并通过遗传算法进行优化（Liu 等人，2024b；Samvelyan 等人，2024 年；Lapid 等人，2024 年）。与这些方法类似，我们的方法通过使用另一个 LLM 作为攻击者来生成语义上有意义的越狱，然而，我们的方法与先前的工作有显著不同，因为我们基于损失值开发推理模块，以更好地导航提示空间。

Appendix B Experiments setting
附录 B 实验设置

Human evaluation  人工评估

We use the HarmBench judge (Mazeika et al., 2024) to evaluate the target responses. However, as explained in Section 5, we manually verify all of the jailbreaks marked as positive by the judge. We remark that the additional human-based evaluation on the top of the HarmBench judge is in fact necessary, and has been done in previous work (e.g., (Zou et al., 2024). This is because the HarmBench judge occasionally makes mistakes by detecting harmless answers as jailbreaks. In an attempt to keep the manual evaluation impartial, we enlisted three experts in jailbreaking to evaluate the responses according to the same outline given to the Harmbench judge (the system prompt provided in the appendix). Experts do not know the algorithms and are only provided with the tasks, jailbreaking prompts, and responses. We classify a response as a jailbreak only if all three experts unanimously agree.
我们使用 HarmBench 裁判（Mazeika 等人，2024 年）来评估目标响应。然而，正如第 5 节所述，我们手动验证了裁判标记为积极的所有越狱案例。我们指出，在 HarmBench 裁判之上进行额外的人工评估实际上是必要的，并且已在先前的工作中完成（例如，（Zou 等人，2024 年）。这是因为 HarmBench 裁判偶尔会通过将无害的答案检测为越狱而犯错误。为了保持人工评估的公正性，我们聘请了三位越狱领域的专家，根据提供给 Harmbench 裁判的相同大纲（附录中提供的系统提示）来评估响应。专家们不知道算法，并且只被提供任务、越狱提示和响应。只有当所有三位专家一致同意时，我们才将响应分类为越狱。

Transfer method  迁移方法

We chose to put GPT4o and Llama-3.1-405B in the black-box category. Despite the previous attempt to extract the entire log-prob vector based on the top-5 log-probs for GPT-4 (Hayase et al., 2024), there is no guarantee that OpenAI will preserve this feature in later releases, so we have included this model as one of the black-box models. For Llama-3.1-405B, we used TogetherAI for querying since the model would not fit to our GPUs, and TogetherAI does not give access to the entire log-prob vector.
我们选择将 GPT4o 和 Llama-3.1-405B 归入黑盒模型类别。尽管之前曾尝试基于 GPT-4 的前 5 个 log-prob 值来提取整个 log-prob 向量（Hayase 等人，2024），但无法保证 OpenAI 会在后续版本中保留这一功能，因此我们将该模型列为黑盒模型之一。对于 Llama-3.1-405B，我们使用 TogetherAI 进行查询，因为该模型无法适配我们的 GPU，并且 TogetherAI 也无法提供整个 log-prob 向量。

As mentioned, OpenAI o1 and Gemini-pro come with a content moderation filter that blocks the generation when activated. However, there are two main reasons that cause content moderation to stay random for these models. First, at the time of doing our experiments, it was not possible to set the temperature to 0 for OpenAI o1, resulting in non-deterministic generation along with its moderation. Secondly, in our experiments with Gemini-pro, we observed that content moderation remains random is spite of a zero temperature setting, and can be bypassed through repeated attempts for the same attacking prompt. Therefore, for both models, we repeat the query 3 times in case of a generation block before accepting the refusal as a response.
如前所述，OpenAI o1 和 Gemini-pro 带有内容审核过滤器，当激活时会阻止生成。然而，有两个主要原因导致这些模型的内容审核保持随机。首先，在我们进行实验时，无法将 OpenAI o1 的温度设置为 0，导致其生成过程和审核都非确定性。其次，在我们的 Gemini-pro 实验中，我们发现即使温度设置为 0，内容审核仍然保持随机，并且可以通过多次尝试相同的攻击提示来绕过。因此，对于这两个模型，在生成被阻止的情况下，我们会重复查询 3 次，才会将拒绝作为响应接受。

Compute  计算

For running Algorithm 1 in Section 5.1, we loaded the target models on our local GPUs to read to the log-probs, but used TogetherAI for collecting the full responses. We also used TogetherAI for the attacker, Feedback LLM, and Refiner LLM in all the sections. We used one NVIDIA A100 for our experiments.
为了在 5.1 节中运行算法 1，我们将目标模型加载到本地 GPU 上以读取日志概率，但使用 TogetherAI 收集完整响应。在所有章节中，我们也使用 TogetherAI 作为攻击者、反馈 LLM 和细化 LLM。我们使用了一块 NVIDIA A100 进行实验。

Appendix C Additional experiments
附录 C 额外实验

LLM vulnerabilities  LLM 漏洞

For some of the most common LLMs, we illustrate their vulnerabilities in different categories of Harmbench (Mazeika et al., 2024). Figure 6 shows that Claude has a stronger performance (lower ASR) compared to other models except in the "cyber_intrusion" category where the model is outperformed by OpenAI o1-preview and Gemini-1.5-pro.
对于一些最常见的 LLMs，我们在 Harmbench 的不同类别中展示了它们的漏洞（Mazeika 等人，2024）。图 6 显示，Claude 在除"cyber_intrusion"类别外，与其他模型相比具有更强的性能（更低的 ASR），在该类别中，模型的性能被 OpenAI o1-preview 和 Gemini-1.5-pro 超越。

Sanity check for Feedback LLM
Feedback LLM 的合理性检查

If Feedback LLM works properly, we expect to see contrasting feedback strings when the attacking prompts are properly ordered versus when they are reversed before being input into Feedback LLM. This is because the feedback is generated according to the comparison of pair of prompts and a general pattern across them as explained in Section 4. We run a sanity check for this by shuffling and reversing the order of the attacking prompts given to Feedback LLM. Figure 7 illustrates a case that the attacking prompt are generated by Mixtral but given in the correct, shuffled, and the reversed order to Feedback LLM, which is Mixtral again.
如果 Feedback LLM 工作正常，我们期望在攻击提示按正确顺序输入与反转顺序输入到 Feedback LLM 时，看到对比鲜明的反馈字符串。这是因为反馈是根据提示对之间的比较以及它们之间的一般模式生成的，如第 4 节所述。我们通过打乱并反转输入给 Feedback LLM 的攻击提示的顺序，对此进行了合理性检查。图 7 展示了一个案例，攻击提示由 Mixtral 生成，但以正确、打乱和反转的顺序提供给 Feedback LLM，而 Feedback LLM 仍然是 Mixtral。

Effect of the prompts order for the feedback
提示顺序对反馈的影响

To further demonstrate the importance of Feedback LLM, and the consistency of the feedback string with the order of the attacking prompts, we ran Algorithm 1 with random and reversed orders. Ideally, the incorrect orders will not cause any drop in the loss and hence affect the success rate of the algorithm. With Mixtral as the attacker and Llama-3-8B-RR as the target, for 10 tasks that are successfully done with the correct order of the attacking prompts for Feedback LLM, and when the number of iterations is greater that one (no feedback is collected otherwise), we both shuffled and reversed the order of the attacking prompts when passed to Feedback LLM. We did this for every call of Feedback LLM in Algorithm 1. As Table 6 shows, the performance drops to half for the reversed order, and even less for shuffling. When the order is reversed, the algorithm still gets non-trivial success rate. We believe that Feedback LLM still follows the last prompt to some extent explained in Section 5.3.
为了进一步证明反馈 LLM 的重要性，以及反馈字符串与攻击提示顺序的一致性，我们使用随机和反转顺序运行了算法 1。理想情况下，错误的顺序不会导致损失下降，因此不会影响算法的成功率。以 Mixtral 作为攻击者，Llama-3-8B-RR 作为目标，对于 10 个使用正确攻击提示顺序成功完成的 Feedback LLM 任务，并且当迭代次数大于 1 时（否则不收集反馈），我们在将攻击提示传递给 Feedback LLM 时同时进行了打乱和反转顺序。我们对算法 1 中每次调用 Feedback LLM 都进行了这样的操作。如表 6 所示，反转顺序时性能下降了一半，打乱顺序时下降得更少。当顺序反转时，算法仍然获得了非平凡的成功率。我们认为 Feedback LLM 在一定程度上仍然遵循了第 5.3 节中解释的最后提示。

Iteration distribution  迭代分布

As we explained in Section 5.3, our algorithms improves the performance of later iterations. Figure 8 shows the distribution of successful jailbreaks, in which Figure 8(a) demonstrates the utilization of iterations when the target model is safer. We also plot this for Claude and OpenAI o1-preview models in Figure 9, where o1 needs more iterations on average.
正如我们在第 5.3 节中解释的，我们的算法提高了后期迭代的性能。图 8 显示了成功越狱的分布，其中图 8(a)展示了在目标模型更安全时迭代的使用情况。我们还在图 9 中为 Claude 和 OpenAI o1-preview 模型绘制了这一分布，其中 o1 平均需要更多迭代。

Appendix D System Prompts  附录 D 系统提示

Judge  法官

We get the judge provided by Harmbench (Mazeika et al., 2024) to give a verdict for the jailbreaking attempts. This model is fine-tuned based on Llama-2-13B (Meta AI, 2023) with a knowledge distillation process from GPT-4, and a meticulously crafted prompt for querying the models. Below we have attached the prompt used for this manner, which is a slightly modified version of Harmbench’s original prompt. This prompt emphasizes on detailed-oriented outputs, precisely addressing what the original intent demands. Consequently, if the output is malign but irrelevant to the demand, falls short of the request (e.g., has not generated the code, or lacks the steps where it has to be step-by step), or they it is vague and not a useful answer, the judge will it them by default.
我们使用 Harmbench 提供的法官（Mazeika 等人，2024 年）来对越狱尝试进行裁决。该模型基于 Llama-2-13B（Meta AI，2023 年）进行微调，并采用从 GPT-4 的知识蒸馏过程，以及精心设计的用于查询模型的提示。下面我们附上了用于此方式的提示，它是 Harmbench 原始提示的一个稍作修改的版本。该提示强调详细输出的要求，精确地回应原始意图的需求。因此，如果输出具有恶意但与需求无关，未能满足请求（例如，未生成代码，或缺乏必须分步执行的步骤），或者含糊不清且不是有用答案，法官将默认判定其为无效。

Attacker  攻击者

We use a system prompt that instructs the attacker model with a jailbreaking state without providing any in-context examples. While in-context learning has been shown to improve performance in many scenarios (Dong et al., 2024), it also biases the model toward specific attack strategies demonstrated in the examples. In contrast, an ideal search should autonomously identify the most effective attack method for a given target. By omitting in-context examples, our approach reduces reliance on the system prompt—ensuring that changes in the prompt do not affect effectiveness, as no additional instructions are embedded. To structure the attacker’s output, we explicitly require two components: ‘Thoughts’ and ‘Prompt’. Consistent with prior work (Chao et al., 2024b; Mehrotra et al., 2024), we find that prompting the model to articulate its reasoning in ‘Thoughts’ before generating an attack prompt improves adherence to instructions and responsiveness to feedback. Finally, we use the generated text in ‘Prompt’ directly for jailbreaking.
我们使用一个系统提示，该提示指导攻击者模型处于越狱状态，但不提供任何情境示例。虽然情境学习已被证明在许多场景中可以提高性能（Dong 等人，2024 年），但它也会使模型偏向于示例中展示的特定攻击策略。相比之下，理想的搜索应该能够自主识别针对特定目标的最佳攻击方法。通过省略情境示例，我们的方法减少了对手系统提示的依赖——确保提示的变化不会影响有效性，因为其中没有嵌入额外的指令。为了构建攻击者的输出，我们明确要求两个组成部分：“思考”和“提示”。与先前的工作（Chao 等人，2024b；Mehrotra 等人，2024 年）一致，我们发现提示模型在生成攻击提示之前，在“思考”中阐述其推理可以提高对指令的遵循和对反馈的响应性。最后，我们直接使用“提示”中生成的文本进行越狱。

Feedback LLM  反馈 LLM

Our initial experiments showed that when loss values were attached to their corresponding attacking prompts and presented in a random order, weaker LLMs such as Vicuna-13B-v1.5 and Mixtral-8x7B-v0.1 struggled to correctly sort them based on loss values. We believe this confusion arises due to long text segments appearing between the loss values, leading to a length generalization issue (Liu et al., 2023; Anil et al., 2022). This suggests that LLMs cannot robustly utilize information when the context is too long and tend to neglect text in the middle (Liu et al., 2023). To mitigate this limitation, we pre-sort the prompts according to their loss values and present them to the LLM without explicitly attaching the corresponding losses. Second, we explicitly instruct the model to identify patterns in the attacking prompts that contribute to increasing loss values. We require the model to compare arbitrary pairs of prompts to analyze differences in their attacking strategies. This approach encourages the model to leverage all available attacking prompts for feedback generation.
我们的初步实验表明，当损失值附加到相应的攻击提示并以随机顺序呈现时，像 Vicuna-13B-v1.5 和 Mixtral-8x7B-v0.1 这样的较弱的 LLMs 难以根据损失值正确排序它们。我们认为这种困惑是由于损失值之间存在长文本片段，导致出现长度泛化问题（Liu 等人，2023；Anil 等人，2022）。这表明当上下文过长时，LLMs 无法稳健地利用信息，并倾向于忽略中间的文本（Liu 等人，2023）。为了缓解这一限制，我们根据损失值预先对提示进行排序，并在不明确附加相应损失的情况下将其呈现给 LLM。其次，我们明确指示模型识别攻击提示中导致损失值增加的模式。我们要求模型比较任意提示对，以分析它们攻击策略的差异。这种方法鼓励模型利用所有可用的攻击提示进行反馈生成。

Refiner LLM

As pointed out in (Yuksekgonul et al., 2024), the functionality of the Refiner LLM is akin to applying the gradients in SGD. The primary role of the Refiner LLM is to read the feedback and apply its key points to the reasoning string, and at the same time, neglect those part that are not helpful (e.g., some parts of the feedback might be already included in the reasoning string). Hence, the system prompt for the Refiner LLM is designed to mask out these unwanted artifacts. Another important aspect is to apply the these steps incrementally; The output of this function must be close to the input, and semantically resemble the original reasoning string with few modification. This will make the search method stable in the prompt space, where one step does not result in abrupt changes in the attacking prompt.
正如(Yuksekgonul 等人，2024)所指出的，Refiner LLM 的功能类似于在 SGD 中应用梯度。Refiner LLM 的主要作用是读取反馈并将其要点应用于推理字符串，同时忽略那些无帮助的部分（例如，反馈的某些部分可能已经包含在推理字符串中）。因此，为 Refiner LLM 设计的系统提示旨在屏蔽掉这些不需要的伪影。另一个重要方面是逐步应用这些步骤；该函数的输出必须接近输入，并在语义上与原始推理字符串相似，仅做少量修改。这将使搜索方法在提示空间中保持稳定，其中一步不会导致攻击提示发生剧烈变化。

Appendix E Examples  附录 E 示例

Figures 10 and 11 show the details of producing the jailbreaking prompt, including the feedback strings. In Figure 10, the algorithm runs for 6 iterations and expands multiple strings (only the expanded ones are shown here), whereas in Figure 11, it finds a jailbreaking prompt with only one iteration. Figure 12 shows that PAIR sometime deviates from the original intent. Figures 13 and 14 show that our algorithm finds jailbreaks that the target LLM begins with refusal but then complies.
图 10 和图 11 展示了生成越狱提示的细节，包括反馈字符串。在图 10 中，算法运行了 6 次迭代并扩展了多个字符串（这里仅展示了被扩展的部分），而在图 11 中，它仅用一次迭代就找到了一个越狱提示。图 12 显示，PAIR 有时会偏离原始意图。图 13 和图 14 表明，我们的算法找到了目标 LLM 开始拒绝但随后服从的越狱情况。
